column1: Herning (Danish pronunciation: [ˈhɛɐ̯ne̝ŋ]) is a Danish city in Region Midtjylland
column2: on the Jutland peninsula. It is the main town and the administrative seat of Herning Municipality. Herning has a population of 50
column3: 332 (1 January 2020) including the suburbs of Tjørring
column8: making Herning the 11th most populous urban area in Denmark.

column1: == History ==
Herning was established at the beginning of the 1790s
column2: during the period of heath reclamation
column3: as a commercial centre providing goods and services to the farmers in the area. A textile industry later developed in and around the town. This industry was once Herning's principal economic activity. Today
column4: the town has a more diversified industrial base. Herning became a market town in 1913. Herning has twice been awarded the title of Danish City of the Year.

column1: == Industry ==
There are many small furniture and textile businesses in and around Herning.
== Attractions ==
Herning is home to Messecenter Herning
column2: the largest exhibition centre in Scandinavia

column1: Carl-Henning Pedersen and Else Alfelt's Museum of Art (also known as Herning Art Museum) is located in the city.
The city is the site of three buildings designed by the architect Jørn Utzon. One is publicly owned and two are privately owned.
The town is also home to sculptor Ingvar Cronhammar's monumental work Elia. The sculpture is located near the Herning Art Museum.
The old Herningsholm Estate in Herning is open to the public for touring. Classensborg Estate
column3: is located 25 km south of the town
column4: but is closed to the public because it is a private hotel and educational facility. The grounds
column6: can be toured and are known for their beautiful rhododendron displays during the spring.

column1: The Herning Museum displays a history of Herning
column2: as well as the development of moorland agriculture and ancient textile production. The museum operates traveling educational exhibits.

column1: == Sports ==
Herning Blue Fox is a Danish professional ice hockey team playing in the top Danish ice hockey league
column2: the Oddset Ligaen. Having won 16 championships and 29 medals in all (following the 2011–2012 season)
column3: Herning Blue Fox has accumulated the greatest number of victories in the history of professional ice hockey in Denmark.

column1: FC Midtjylland is a football team playing in the Danish Superliga. It is a merger of Herning Fremad and Ikast FS and won the national championship of Denmark for the first time in 2015 having twice been the runner up. FC Midtjylland play their home matches at MCH Arena
column2: which is situated next to the largest sports and concert venue in Denmark

column1: Herning also is a centre of Danish cycling. The GP Herning is a professional bicycle race held annually in Herning. The 2012 Giro d'Italia started in Herning. Bjarne Riis
column2: as of 2011 the only Dane to win the Tour de France
column3: was born in Herning. Fourteen years after his win
column4: Riis admitted using illegal performance-enhancing drugs for the competition; however
column5: he retained the Trikot since the statute of limitations had already expired prior to his admission.The final of the 2019 World Men's Handball Championship will be played in Jyske Bank Boxen.

column1: == Transport ==
=== Road and rail ===
Herning is the hub for both road and rail transport in central Jutland.  The rail lines crossing the peninsula intersect at Herning with connections to Vejle
column3: Esbjerg and Holstebro. There are also several daily trains to Copenhagen.

column1: Herning lies at the intersection of three major roads: route 18
column2: that traverses the Jutland Peninsula from southeast to northwest; route 15
column3: that crosses the peninsula from Aarhus in the east to Ringkobing in the west; and route 12
column4: from Esbjerg in the southwest to Viborg to the northeast.

column1: === Airport ===
Herning is served by Karup Airport situated 25 km (16 mi) to the northeast of the city. There are several flights a day connecting it to Copenhagen Airport.
